subject_terms_3: Force 136 (Guerilla movement) Tan, Chong Tee 1942-1945 Japanese occupation Letters
physical_appearance: This is a reproduced document certifying honourable discharge from Force 136. The title is printed at the top-center of the document. Below it, there is a signature on the left, with a identification photograph on the right. There is a Force 136 stamp marked against the photograph. The date and signature is marked at the bottom of the document.
sgcool_label_text:
This reproduction belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.
